Number of input images to average into a single output image

If true, then perform a moving average over the sweep, i.e. given images 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, ..., with averaging over three images, the output frames would cover 1-3, 2-4, 3-5, 4-6, etc. Otherwise, a straight summation is performed: 1-3, 4-6, 7-9, etc.

Interval (in degrees) between B-factors on rotation axis

qualifiers.toolTip: Whether to do the secondary beam correction in the camera spindle frame or the crystal frame
Select XDS processing pipeline. 3d: XDS, XSCALE, LABELIT 3di: as 3d, but use 3 wedges for indexing 3dii: XDS, XSCALE, using all images for autoindexing 3dd: as 3d, but use DIALS for indexing
Assume that the dataset comes from a chemical crystallography experiment

qualifiers.guiLabel: Beam centre coordinates (mm, mm) using the Mosflm convention
qualifiers.toolTip: Override the beam centre from the image headers, following the mosflm convention.
The detector distance (used when mosflm_beam_centre is set)

qualifiers.guiLabel: Beam centre coordinates (px fast, px slow, [panel id])
qualifiers.toolTip: Override the beam centre from the image headers. The first two values are the fast and slow pixel coordinate. If the third is supplied it specifies a panel number.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Beam centre coordinates (px slow, px fast, [panel id])
qualifiers.toolTip: Alternative to fast_slow_beam_centre in which the coordinates are given in order (px slow, px fast, [panel id]). If fast_slow_beam_centre is set it will take priority over any values set here.
Override the axis for a single axis goniometer. Equivalent to providing a single 3D vector to 'axes'.
Override the goniometer axes. Axes must be provided in the order crystal-to-goniometer, i.e. for a Kappa goniometer phi,kappa,omega
Override the goniometer angles. Axes must be provided in the order crystal-to-goniometer, i.e. for a Kappa goniometer phi,kappa,omega

The scan axis

Invert the rotation axis

Override the image oscillation
Override the batch offset

When overriding the scan, convert sequences into stills

Total number of free reflections

Reference models.expt for testing of alternative indexing schemes
Run dials.two_theta_refine to refine the unit cell and obtain estimated standard uncertainties on the cell parameters. Only relevant to DIALS pipeline.

Use equal-volume bins or bins with approximately equal numbers of reflections per bin.
Keep anomalous pairs separate in merging statistics
Reject reflections with normalised intensities E^2 > emax^2
For one crystal, multiple orientations, unify U matrix
Whether or not to trust the beam centre in the image header. If false, then the DIALS indexer will attempt to find a better beam centre during indexing.
Tolerance for accepting two different wavelengths as the same wavelength.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Check cell deviation in XDS IDXREF

qualifiers.toolTip: Use the Brehm-Diederichs algorithm to resolve an indexing ambiguity. See: W. Brehm and K. Diederichs, Acta Cryst. (2014). D70, 101-109. )
Use profile fitting not summation integration, default yes
Exclude measurements from regions which are typically where ice rings land
If xia2.json file is present from a previous xia2 job then continue scaling from the previous integration results.
This feature requires the dials project to be installed, and is not currently intended for general use. Use at your peril!
Tolerance to use in POINTLESS for comparison of data sets
Override detector serial number information
Index all sweeps together rather than combining individual results (requires dials indexer)

Refine all sweeps together, restraining unit cell parameters to their median, rather than refining sweeps individually (requires dials refiner). If this is set to True, multi_sweep_indexing will also be set to True.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Reject lattice if constraints increase RMSD

qualifiers.toolTip: Use AIMLESS or cctbx for calculation of merging statistics
Use internal variance of the data in the calculation of the merged sigmas.
Eliminate systematically absent reflections before computation of merging statistics.
Whether to process each sweep in serial (using n processes per sweep) or to process sweeps in parallel (using 1 process per sweep).
The number of processors to use per job.
The number of sweeps to process simultaneously.
How to run the parallel processing jobs, e.g. over a cluster
The command to use to submit qsub jobs
Use internal variance of the data in the calculation of the merged sigmas
Eliminate systematically absent reflections before computation of merging statistics.
Minimum value of completeness in outer resolution shell used to determine suitable resolution cutoff for CHEF analysis
This controls which pdb mmcif dictionary version the output mmcif file should comply with. Unmerged data is exported in both formats, v5_next adds additional support for scan metadata.
